1055824677396979715.text:
7. Privacy. Institutional investors, and indeed any investor, can't invest if all their holdings and trade is known to the world.

Privacy is not a 3rd layer solution, it must be backed and optimized as a core native capability, with full settings and control

1055824676197412864.text:
6. Regulation. This is what most people miss about Security Tokens. They should not just be regulation-compliant, they can be regulation enforcing

I see a shared, open-source, regulation add-on repository at the blockchain level, which every asset can choose from to be compliant

1055824674926575621.text:
Theoretically, owners can also publish intent to buy/sell, or even put tokens/currency in a contract waiting for a counter

Regulated exchanges can then aggregate demand and connect buyers/sellers, use the chain as their underlying shared tech infrastructure and liquidity pool

1055824673051762689.text: 5. Trades. Trades should be natively atomic - one side gives tokens, the other side pays - and the swap is one transaction. Can be instant, or based on smart contract logic / conditions, or even support fiat payments.

1055824671743115264.text:
Nodes are highly incentivised to upload quality assets and KYA:

Good faith = asset lifetime revenues
Bad faith = lose reputation, revenues, legal

The whole ecosystem game theory is optimized for TRUST that what the chain says about real-world assets is legally-enforceable TRUTH

1055824670321229826.text:
4. Consensus: a variation of Proof of Authority for proving Ownership

Every asset picks one Primary Node
The Primary Node does the KYA and uploads to chain
It writes ALL transactions in that asset to blocks, so it is rewarded by asset lifetime revenues

Highly scalable by design

1055824668983259136.text:
The 3rd principle: The nodes on an ownership blockchain must be trusted ownership experts, capable of uploading assets to the chain by doing the KYA, and staking their REPUTATION on its quality.

Investment banks, exchanges, ST issuance companies, RE companies, Broker Dealers...

1055824667796234241.text:
The 2nd principle: every Assets must have KYA (Know your Asset)

KYA is a set of LEGAL docs that defines the asset + token holder rights. It should be verified, and saved immutably on chain.

KYA is the unbreakable legal link between off and on-chain, for any asset class.

1055824666324017153.text:
The 1st principle of a blockchain base layer for securities, is that it must NOT be anonymous. Every Owner must pass KYC/AML.

Like the move from Myspace to Facebook, it changes everything, not a technical thing that can be bypassed at layer 3

Identity is the CORE of ownership
